alert.note: Alert for Naguabo (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 28 at 8:44PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is ongoing. * WHERE...Rio Blanco`s basin in Naguabo. * WHEN...Until midnight AST tonight. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Various roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 742 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated that heavy rain has ended, with radar-estimated rainfall totals between 1 and 3 inches over the warned area. Nonetheless, excessive runoff maintains Rio Blanco streamflow above flood stage. In fact, emergency management reported ongoing flooding along Rio Blanco`s banks, affecting road PR-191 near Sector Pitina, Barrio Florida in Naguabo. This road remains impassable. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
